Los Angeles, CA 4/13/2012 4 Check-ins Here This a great hamburger restaurant for family get-togethers or small groups. I usually get the grilled chicken sandwich or the 2/3 burger, which are always fresh, and some of their awesome seasoned potato wedges. Having the self-serve bar for all your sandwich and burger fixings is great too. Simple and good food.
The highlight of Fuddruckers for me is the $7 domestic beer pitchers. They're full size pitchers and they give you chilled mugs. You can't beat that price at any other sit-down restaurant.
There's always free parking and it's located right in the heart of downtown Burbank so it's a great area to walk after eating all that food.

Woodland Hills, CA 12/16/2011 1 Check-in Here I always used to go to the one in Thousand Oaks... and when that one closed, I hadn't been to a Fuddruckers in a long time... years probably.
Okay, so it was about 5 o'clock tonight... I am exhausted. I mean, I am dead tired... but I promised a friend I would go out to eat with them...and the thing is, I'm the only one with a car... so sadly, that means I need to drive. So I'm driving down Wells...since I cannot deal with traffic... it makes me lose my mind! So my friend decides to take over driving for me...which is great for me...and I haven't really been driven in my car...so I sit in the passenger seat and pass out. hahaha. Well, not really... but the heated seats make me want to fall asleep... but I decide to play with their ipod since again, I am never in the passenger seat. Anyway, on a side note when I'm sleepy... I totally don't act like myself. I think just about everything is funny... and I am less inhibited I guess? So the whole 2 hours it takes to get there... well it took over an hour... since the traffic was MURDER in Sherman Oaks/Encino... I start belting out Bon Jovi - It's My Life, Beatles - Good Morning Good Morning, My Precious, My Bus (a "supposed" hard rock song)&That FT Island song (which are all in Korean - um, I do not know Korean... but can sing it?!), some Justin Timberlake songs...just basically whatever they had on their ipod that I actually knew... hahaha.. I don't know what this has to do with this place... but that was my experience on coming here.
We finally get here at 7... and the parking again is a nightmare. There is so much traffic... but hey, it's downtown Burbank... so at least that was expected. Finally find a parking spot... and walk down to the place.
The inside is larger than the Thousand Oaks location... but it's much older and kind of "dirtier". I mean I guess the tables are clean... but it's kind of run down..and older. This location also carries different types of meats: Wild Boar, Elk and Buffalo. So I decided to go with the Elk burger... hahaha. No! I am totally kidding... hahaha. I won't even eat seafood... it's too weird for me! But if you're feeling like Andrew Zimmern, you should go for it...
I typically get the 3 cheese burger... so I had that. You put everything on your burger yourself... and so I usually just put a whole bunch of red onions on it and a few pickles... but they have tomatoes, lettuce, regular white onions, relish, and cucumber slices.
Also, on the other table they have sauces: mayo (::shudder::), spicy mustard, regular mustard, ketchup, honey mustard...and I am sure there are a couple others.
The strawberry shake is pretty tasty... so yum! Had some of that...
Other than that, I don't know what to say. A burger is a burger... I mean it is good... but I don't know.

Los Angeles, CA 12/14/2010 I love these burgers. I think they are some of the best in SoCal.
You order at a counter then take a vibrating coaster thing to your table and it flashes&vibrates when your order is ready.
You order burgers by size (1/3 pound, 1/2 pound, 1 pound) and they have a few options for cheese&sauce. When you pick up your burger it's pretty much "naked" but they have a serve yourself toppings bar and you can put as much of whatever you want on there :)
They have good fries (I usually get honey mustard to dip em in). They also sell beer. They have deserts but I'm always too full try them.
They have a large comfortable seating area. The decor reminds me of a Bennigan's or a Fridays except a bit more kid friendly.
There's a big parking deck (free) right next to the place. You can usually find parking except on weekend evenings (that whole area gets busy).

I'm pretty good at this game, as I start with a cheeseburger and add tons and tons of each of the cheeses, then throw on a bunch of mayonnaise, Tabasco, mustard, some onions if I'm feeling particularly sassy, then a little more cheese just in case, and then some more cheese. But then you realize that you essentially paid $10 for a bowl of cheese and mayonnaise. Their fries are consistently soggy as well, but also serve as a solid starting point for the above-mentioned game.
But I DO like games, so three stars.

Los Angeles, CA 1/2/2007 Ruddfuckers hehehhehehehhehehehehhehehehehheheheh.
Best burger in the world you say, Mr. Leno? Hardly, but damn satisfying nonetheless.
Among the condoments (ehhehehehhehehhe, ok enough) are mayo and this melted cheese sauce type stuff. I don't know what it is, but a friend would load up his burgers with that nonsense. He has since had three heart attacks, and at 22 that's quite a feat (da bears).
You know, for a burger joint their toppings are pretty fresh. Tomatoes and onions and lettuce and pickles and such, it's all crisp and awesome. Myself, I go for the half pounder and add ketchup, mayo, one slice of tomato, a few leaves of lettuce, and 34 slices of onion. I order it medium well (the only meat I'll not eat medium rare) because I fear the stomach sickies.
But wait, there's more! They also have bottled beer. Heine, Corona and whatnot, but no liquor (something I can overlook because, hey, burgers!) If that's not your style, they got fountain drinks with free refills.
The fries aren't anything special, kinda soggy if I remember correctly, as well as platters of other foodstuffs, nothing mind blowing.

Seattle, WA 3/29/2007 Do not order their fish and chips! Fuddruckers is meant for hamburgers, big juicy, creative hamburgers. Why I went here as a pesco-lacto-ovo-vegetarian? We were famished and stuck in Burbank and before we hiked back to our car in whatever floor on whichever parking structure. Their shakes were a bit too thick for my liking and their fries were seasoned. I highly prefer just plain, straight fries, put in the fryer and then salted to my liking...no orange fancy, snancy stuff for this girl.
Definitely your bucks worth for the amount of food they give you. Although I'm not sure if I'm a fan of the "Build it Yourself" condiment island. All my Quality Assurance and Food Safety classes frown down upon such things.
Kieran of course enjoyed and devoured his hamburger...my fish and chips...well they were the quality of frozen breaded fish you can buy at the market. I know my fish and chips and these were definitely not fresh.
When I start eating meat again, I'll come back Fuddruckers...PROMISE.

Burbank, CA 4/16/2007 It is what it is, and what Fuddruckers is is big, decent burgers with a serve-yourself topping/condiment bar that makes it all worth while.
The smallest burger (unless you get the kid's meal, which is 1/5-lb) is 1/3 lb, and it only goes up from there. You order your topping-less burger at the counter (where you do have choices like bacon, cheese, grilled onions), then grab all the other toppings you want at the self-serve counter. I loaded my bacon cheddar burger up with onions, mustard, ketchup and extra extra extra pickles. Like a million pickles. That's how I roll.
I think I'll try the onion rings next time, but the seasoned fries (giant potato wedges, actually) were great as well.
Great for a quick bite before or after the movies.

Glendale, CA 3/16/2007 You want a decent burger with tons of choices of what you want on it? Fuddruckers will give you far too many choices for the type of burger you want. Basically, that's what they have. Burgers. Pick the size, pick the type (beef, garden, chicken, turkey, and even sometimes ostrich), pick the toppings, pick a side, pay and sit down. Your pager will go off and you go pick up your burger. Fill it up with whatever condiments you want at the condiment / toppings bar and sit back down to enjoy.
I've never really been into this place, but I loved it when I was a kid. When you're a kid, you love having the choice to put as many pickles on your burger as you want. No adult is gonna tell you what to do! But as an adult, I'd rather have someone put the crap on my burger for me, otherwise, I'd just barbeque a burger at home.
My favorite burger to get is the INFERNO. They load the burger up with grilled onions and jalapenos, then douse it with hot sauce. I take it back to my table and load it up with a good slathering of Tobasco, and it's pretty tasty. It doesn't make me sweat, but it'll be slightly uncomfortable ... good for a work lunch.
The decor here is weird. It's all 1950s rock and roll stuff for the most part. It's like a flea market just vomited on all the walls and ceilings around you. As a kid, I loved it. Now, it just all fades into the background in a giant mush of memorabilia.
Working in Burbank, you hear all kinds of weird folklore and rumors. This one was supposed to be a huge hangout for lecherous gay guys, who would convene in the bathrooms in the afternoon around 3pm (almost like the recurring joke from the Kids in the Hall's 'Brain Candy'). I've only ever had lunch here, but I've never seen any convention happening in the bathroom.
Great place to go if you want a quick burger in a slightly nicer setting than the corner burger hole, just don't expect too much. And if you're here around 3pm, check out the bathroom.
